comments.author: ianburrows_au@yahoo.com
comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:9.0a1) Gecko/20110918 Firefox/9.0a1 SeaMonkey/2.6a1
Build ID: 20110918064823

Steps to reproduce:

Trying to build a pgo (profile guided optimisation) firefox from tip of tree.  
Have successfully built non-pgo firefox (and seamonkey and thunderbird for years).
Setup - Linux Ubuntu 11.04, fully patched
ian@tqft:~$ gcc -v
Using built-in specs.
COLLECT_GCC=/usr/bin/gcc-4.5.real
COLLECT_LTO_WRAPPER=/usr/lib/i386-linux-gnu/gcc/i686-linux-gnu/4.5.2/lto-wrapper
Target: i686-linux-gnu
Configured with: ../src/configure -v --with-pkgversion='Ubuntu/Linaro 4.5.2-8ubuntu4' --with-bugurl=file:///usr/share/doc/gcc-4.5/README.Bugs --enable-languages=c,c++,fortran,objc,obj-c++ --prefix=/usr --program-suffix=-4.5 --enable-shared --enable-multiarch --with-multiarch-defaults=i386-linux-gnu --enable-linker-build-id --with-system-zlib --libexecdir=/usr/lib/i386-linux-gnu --without-included-gettext --enable-threads=posix --with-gxx-include-dir=/usr/include/c++/4.5 --libdir=/usr/lib/i386-linux-gnu --enable-nls --with-sysroot=/ --enable-clocale=gnu --enable-libstdcxx-debug --enable-libstdcxx-time=yes --enable-plugin --enable-gold --enable-ld=default --with-plugin-ld=ld.gold --enable-objc-gc --enable-targets=all --disable-werror --with-arch-32=i686 --with-tune=generic --enable-checking=release --build=i686-linux-gnu --host=i686-linux-gnu --target=i686-linux-gnu
Thread model: posix
gcc version 4.5.2 (Ubuntu/Linaro 4.5.2-8ubuntu4) 

.mozconfig (aka ffpgosafe in the build script below)
# Options for client.mk.
mk_add_options MOZ_CO_PROJECT=browser
#mk_add_options MOZ_OBJDIR=/sourcetrees/programs/mozilla/obj-@CONFIG_GUESS@/ffpgo
mk_add_options MOZ_MAKE_FLAGS=-j5


# Options for 'configure' (same as command-line options).
mk_add_options MOZ_BUILD_PROJECTS="browser"
ac_add_app_options browser --enable-application=browser

# Options for 'optimize' (same as command-line options).
ac_add_options --enable-optimize
ac_add_options --disable-crashreporter
#ac_add_options --disable-tests

#enable ccache
ac_add_options --with-ccache


mk_add_options AUTOCONF=autoconf2.13

#enable PGO
#mk_add_options PROFILE_GEN_SCRIPT=/home/ian/firefox-pgo.sh
# from https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=559964 --- Comment #144
mk_add_options MOZ_PGO=1
ac_add_options --enable-stdcxx-compat

export CFLAGS="-gdwarf-2"
export CXXFLAGS="-gdwarf-2"
mk_add_options PROFILE_GEN_SCRIPT='$(PYTHON) $(MOZ_OBJDIR)/browser/_profile/pgo/profileserver.py 10'
#mk_add_options PROFILE_GEN_SCRIPT='$(PYTHON) $(MOZ_OBJDIR)/ffpgo/_profile/pgo/profileserver.py'
#from https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=559964#c20
#mk_add_options  PROFILE_GEN_SCRIPT='$(PYTHON) @TOPSRCDIR@/_profile/pgo/profileserver.py'


build script


#!/bin/bash

function checktree()
{
wget --proxy=off -qO- "http://tinderbox.mozilla.org/showbuilds.cgi?tree=Firefox&quickparse=1"| awk 'BEGIN {FS="|"} $1=="Build" && $3~/Linux/ && $3~/comm-central/ && $4!="success" {
echo $1
echo $2
echo $4
 exit 1 }'
}

if checktree
then
echo "The tree is green"

cp /sourcetrees/programs/mozilla/mozilla/ffpgosafe /sourcetrees/programs/mozilla/central/mozilla-central/.mozconfig
cd /sourcetrees/programs/mozilla/central/mozilla-central
#hg pull -r default && hg update && make -f client.mk profiledbuild
hg pull -r default && hg update && make -f client.mk build

else
	echo "The tree is burning, or tests failed"
	exit 1
fi

exit 


result from most recent attempt
processing /sourcetrees/programs/mozilla/central/mozilla-central/browser/components/certerror/jar.mn
processing /sourcetrees/programs/mozilla/central/mozilla-central/browser/locales/jar.mn
Makefile:81: browser_forgetthissite_single.js temporarily disabled because of very frequent oranges, see bug 551540
processing /sourcetrees/programs/mozilla/central/mozilla-central/browser/components/places/jar.mn
processing /sourcetrees/programs/mozilla/central/mozilla-central/browser/components/preferences/jar.mn
processing /sourcetrees/programs/mozilla/central/mozilla-central/browser/components/search/jar.mn
processing /sourcetrees/programs/mozilla/central/mozilla-central/browser/components/sessionstore/jar.mn
processing /sourcetrees/programs/mozilla/central/mozilla-central/browser/components/privatebrowsing/jar.mn
processing /sourcetrees/programs/mozilla/central/mozilla-central/browser/components/feeds/jar.mn
processing /sourcetrees/programs/mozilla/central/mozilla-central/browser/components/safebrowsing/jar.mn
processing /sourcetrees/programs/mozilla/central/mozilla-central/browser/components/shell/jar.mn
processing /sourcetrees/programs/mozilla/central/mozilla-central/browser/components/migration/jar.mn
processing /sourcetrees/programs/mozilla/central/mozilla-central/browser/devtools/jar.mn
/sourcetrees/programs/mozilla/central/mozilla-central/browser/app/nsBrowserApp.cpp: In function ‘int main(int, char**)’:
/sourcetrees/programs/mozilla/central/mozilla-central/browser/app/nsBrowserApp.cpp:214:77: warning: comparison between signed and unsigned integer expressions
Makefile:81: browser_forgetthissite_single.js temporarily disabled because of very frequent oranges, see bug 551540
make[2]: *** No rule to make target `package'.  Stop.
make[1]: *** [profiledbuild] Error 2
make: *** [build] Error 2

Nb:ccache has alternately been enabled and disabled

Iterations tried with same result
1) set pgo flags as per bugs and attempt - same result, ccache enabled
2) make -f client.mk distclean, rm -rf & rmdir of mozilla-central, start fresh, ccache enabled
3) make -f client.mk distclean,  ccache disabled
4) make -f client.mk distclean, clear ccache (ccache -C), ccache enabled

In between 1) & 2) I attempted some client.mk hacking, changing line 213 of client.mk
$(MAKE) -C $(PGO_OBJDIR) package
to 
$(MAKE) -C /sourcetrees/programs/mozilla/central/mozilla-central/sourcetrees/programs/mozilla/central/mozilla-central/obj-i686-pc-linux-gnu/browser
and this got the profiling stage to run - I could see the browser open and run its profiling steps

Suspect: client.mk is not issuing commands exactly as expected to achieve the desired results
Possible related bugs
https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=558180
https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=648701






Actual results:


make[2]: *** No rule to make target `package'.  Stop.
make[1]: *** [profiledbuild] Error 2
make: *** [build] Error 2


Expected results:

firefox should have built successfully with PGO on

attached is output of latest build run (ie ./ffbuild.sh >builderror4.txt) in case there is something informative in the output

comments.text:
Created attachment 562265
output from build run - case 4, distclean and ccache cleared

comments.raw_text: Can you try removing --disable-tests from your mozconfig? If I had to guess, that would be the most likely candidate for breaking things.
comments.text: Can you try removing --disable-tests from your mozconfig? If I had to guess, that would be the most likely candidate for breaking things.
comments.creator: ted@mielczarek.org
comments.author: ted@mielczarek.org

comments.creator: ianburrows_au@yahoo.com
comments.author: ianburrows_au@yahoo.com
comments.raw_text:
--disable-test was commented out, but anyway
Ran make -f client.mk, edited .mozconfig to remove the line, make -f client.mk build, ccache on - did NOT pull latest updates so same source as run 4) above

Same result

make[2]: Leaving directory `/sourcetrees/programs/mozilla/central/mozilla-central'
make -C obj-i686-pc-linux-gnu package
make[2]: Entering directory `/sourcetrees/programs/mozilla/central/mozilla-central/obj-i686-pc-linux-gnu'
make[2]: *** No rule to make target `package'.  Stop.
make[2]: Leaving directory `/sourcetrees/programs/mozilla/central/mozilla-central/obj-i686-pc-linux-gnu'
make[1]: *** [profiledbuild] Error 2
make[1]: Leaving directory `/sourcetrees/programs/mozilla/central/mozilla-central'
make: *** [build] Error 2

Somehow it seems the correct value for where to execute the profiling run from is not being passed correctly.
How does the main build system do it?
If I deleted everything from the .mozconfig except
mk_add_options MOZ_PGO=1
ac_add_options --enable-stdcxx-compat

export CFLAGS="-gdwarf-2"
export CXXFLAGS="-gdwarf-2"
mk_add_options PROFILE_GEN_SCRIPT='$(PYTHON) $(MOZ_OBJDIR)/browser/_profile/pgo/profileserver.py 10'

would it work?  rm -rf the tree and clear ccache?  redownload the tree and try that?

comments.raw_text:
Next attempt based on 
http://atlee.ca/blog/2011/09/30/mozconfigs-and-branches/ and  https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=558180

make -f client.mk distclean, rm .mozconfig, make -f client.mk build
works produces a result with out apparent error.

No way to tell if it used PGO - tried about:buildconfig nothing I could see, don't think it used ccache unless that is enabled by default.

To enable PGO and ccache I would need to do what?  If I setup a mozconfig, than the stuff from 55810 isn't called, if I don't there is no opportunity to insert them as tthe build process is already underway.
comments.text:
Next attempt based on 
http://atlee.ca/blog/2011/09/30/mozconfigs-and-branches/ and  https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=558180

make -f client.mk distclean, rm .mozconfig, make -f client.mk build
works produces a result with out apparent error.

No way to tell if it used PGO - tried about:buildconfig nothing I could see, don't think it used ccache unless that is enabled by default.

To enable PGO and ccache I would need to do what?  If I setup a mozconfig, than the stuff from 55810 isn't called, if I don't there is no opportunity to insert them as tthe build process is already underway.
comments.creator: ianburrows_au@yahoo.com
comments.author: ianburrows_au@yahoo.com
john@pointysoftware.net
comments.creator: john@pointysoftware.net
comments.text:
I'm also seeing weirdness when trying to do PGO in linux builds. Copying the buildbot's mozconfig, PGO never seems to run. Adding a def for MOZ_PGO=1 *does* run the profile step, but then the build errors out.

I suspect the buildbot config is wrong and skipping PGO, so it went unnoticed when busted at some point -- but I'm far too unfamiliar with the build system to say for sure.
comments.raw_text:
I'm also seeing weirdness when trying to do PGO in linux builds. Copying the buildbot's mozconfig, PGO never seems to run. Adding a def for MOZ_PGO=1 *does* run the profile step, but then the build errors out.

I suspect the buildbot config is wrong and skipping PGO, so it went unnoticed when busted at some point -- but I'm far too unfamiliar with the build system to say for sure.

comments.author: ted@mielczarek.org
comments.creator: ted@mielczarek.org
comments.raw_text:
We disabled PGO on our per-checkin builds a while ago (bug 658313). You can try the release mozconfig for one that ensures that PGO is enabled:
http://mxr.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/source/browser/config/mozconfigs/linux32/release
comments.text:
We disabled PGO on our per-checkin builds a while ago (bug 658313). You can try the release mozconfig for one that ensures that PGO is enabled:
http://mxr.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/source/browser/config/mozconfigs/linux32/release

comments.creator: ianburrows_au@yahoo.com
comments.author: ianburrows_au@yahoo.com
comments.raw_text:
It works now

Not exactly sure what the difference is but at a guess this line
. $topsrcdir/build/unix/mozconfig.linux
works with https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=558180 (moving mozconfigs into sourcetree) whereas earlier when I posted this, that was a work in progress
